abilitygroupdescription.p: Represents book learning on a wide variety of fields through academic study.

abilitydescription.p: The character may call themselves an Apothecary, and can prepare poisons, Laudanum, War-Fire, Foaming Plaster, Colloidal Silver, and medicines for certain diseases. The character must have alchemical equipment.

Alchemy is concerned with the creation of chemical substances, the creation of cures for various diseases, the creation of solvents (acids), liquid fire, dies, gunpowder, etc. If the character has the necessary ingredients they can check to manufacture acids, dyes, blackpowder, inks, petards, grenades, poultices etc. They can identify many chemical substances. In need they may be able to substitute some substances during creation to make solutions of lesser strength. Possesion of relevant equipment such as a Mortar and Pestle should provide a bonus to the Check, at the GM's discretion.

The ingredient used to manufacture these items may be expensive. Furthermore they may have a limited shelf life as moisture in the air and internal alchmical reactions can reduce the efficacy of these items over time. For these reasons alchemical creations are often created before embarking on an endeavour and any unused items are discarded afterwards.
In addition the character can make lore checks regarding the chemical composition of solutions, metals etc and might be able to conjecture on their origins and purposes.
Two, as yet, unattained goals of alchemy are the transmutation of lead into gold, and the creation of an elixir of immortality.

The character can prepare Alkahest (requires Bile of the White Worm), a Potion of Living Death (requires serpents venom), Tears of Lethe (requires Laudanum), Limaceous Grease (requires the ichor of a demon), Smoked snigglets (requires fresh swamp snigglets), Ignis Sacer (requires rye bread and a few weeks of time), or Spirits of Quickening.

The character has studied the history of antique objects, furniture, vases, coins, maps, swords, etc. They can check to evaluate the worth and provenance of these objects. At higher ranks they can, with difficulty, discern the nature of certain well-known eldritch objects.
The character has an understanding of minor surgery: setting bones, trepanning, dentistry, cataract couchery, pig-gelding, and cutting hair.

Book keeping encompasses accounting and financial abilities. Book keeping is used by merchants, clerks, and castellans, to manage finances. With this ability an character can examine the books of a business to get an idea of how the business operates, whether it is doing well or badly, how much debt is owed if any, where the money is coming from and going to, and so on.
The character has had access to and has read some books. They have a broader understanding of the world than their less educated peers.

The alchemist makes a Grand Discovery!! (maybe). Every time the character gains a rank in this ability roll 2d12 on the Grand Discovery table. If the character makes several Grand Discoveries and receives a duplicate result then they reroll, except for the Disappointment, Transmutation and Surprise Discovery results. Mastery for this ability is one, so the character only needs to make this check once before being able to gain the next rank of this ability. Only one check is allowed per rank. It takes the character 3d4 days to perform the applied experimentation for this check, for which they require a suitably equipped laboratory. This experimentation must be done prior to making the check.

tablerow.td: Untamed Brute. The characters brutish nature comes to the fore at times of stress. Gain the “Untamed Brute” Aspect.
Unexpected Discovery. Gain a rank in alchemy.
Poison Resistance, +5 to saves vs being poisoned.
Arcane Knowledge. Gain 1x promotions in magic and 2x promotions in fine arts, lore or special abilities (promotions cannot be used to gain more Grand Discoveries)

Transmutation. After years of practice you finally are able to transmute lead into gold. Unfortunately you can't work out how to repeat the process. Fortunatly you transmute a lot of lead the first time.
Enhanced Ability: Roll d6 on a 1: Gain Speed +2, 2: Gain Str +2, 3: Gain Agility +2, 4: Gain Perception +2, 5: Gain Endurance +2, 6: Choose. This change is permanent
Elixir of Life. The alchemist has somehow ceased their own aging.
Forbidden Knowledge. Gain 3x promotions in magic and 3x promotions in fine arts, lore or special abilities (promotions cannot be used to gain more Grand Discoveries). Gain a Patreon.
Surprise Discovery. Choose a Grand Discovery - no duplicates allowed.

abilitydescription.p: History is the study of the events of the civilized peoples. Its study is both interesting and useful.

The character is able to create a 50cm20" tall humanoid servitor from flesh. The homunculus has a mental link with its creator but has limited intelligence. The homonculus always knows where its master is and will be able to find its master when it pleases. It is capable of running errands and assisting in combat. Homunculi must do what their creator tells them, unless they get really excited. Homunculi are very hard to contain. They often escape from enclosures through unknown devious means.

When creating an homunculus a character gathers the requisite material, off-cuts from a fresh corpse, a variety of alchemical reagents and a manual for the binding, They make the check to create the homoculus. If they fail the ingredients are wasted and must be destroyed. If successful the creation will rise within a few hours. An homunculus can have only one master. It will only do as directed by others if it feels its master would want that. If someone creates two homuculi they will both try and destroy the other. This never ends well.

When assisting in combat the homunculus has 3 hit points, no stamina an armour of +2 (they're small and nasty) and provides a +1 to hit and damage bonus to one character fighting in melee hand to hand. That character need not be its master. Homunculi love fighting and their master must make a Mettle DC2 check to control them when any physical combat begins or the homuculus will automatically attack. A similar check may be made to control the homunculus when they get excited for other reasons.

Homonculi are basically an ambulatory fetish, possessed by some minor demon from beyond. Their actions are strongly curtailed by the rigourous, standardized and very lengthy binding that is part of their creation ritual. However, homoculi frequently resort to type, eating the flesh of humans or excrement when they can, laughing loudly at the misfortune of others, and if left on their own the might resort to theft, or the mutilation of animals. They have been known to murder small children or light fires, but it is believed that all such loopholes have now been covered in their binding ritual.

Homoculi attract a certain amount of attention. Clothes should be made for them so as not to attract more attention than is absolutely necessary as their bodies are hideous. Alternatively they may be carried around in a box.

Thankfully, homonculi do not talk a great deal. When they do they usually being sycophantic, or sarcastic. They delight in the misfortune of others which really excites them. They may get jealous if their master pays too much attention to others.

Homunculi do not really die unless their body is destroyed beyond recognition, is burned or eaten . They can be healed by simply sewing them back together. If someone chooses to do this they will regain all health after a long rest.

An understanding of the law grants the character insight into the way society works. The practice of law invariably leads to the heart of industry and the seats of power. Characters may be able to discern the motive behind political machinations and they may be able to cite a legal precedent in order to compel or cease certain courses of events in a civilized society.

Law is the study of the laws of a particular society. The study of the laws of one society is not necessarilly applicable to another. When choosing the law ability the player must specify which legal system they are studying.

At first rank this represents having a good, but not professional, understanding of the law of some land. Usually, the characters homeland. At higher ranks this ability represents a professional rank of understanding of the law, and some understanding of the laws in surrounding regions.
Maths is the lingua franca of science. A basic understanding of maths is a prerequisite for many other abilities. It can be applied in a very large and diverse range of circumstances.

The study of nature. The character has some knowledge of the flora and fauna of their homelands. They may identify many plants and may know about useful herbal remedies for certain diseases or for use in the the making of poultices. They have some understanding of zoology and anatomy. They may be able to identify interesting information about natural beasts.
For each higher rank the character gains information on an additional new biome through which they have travelled.

The character is a specialist medical diagnostician. They are responsible for diagnosing what is wrong with people and balancing their humours. Their treatments include modifying the diets of their patients, proscribing, but not creating, ointments, tinctures and potions, and the medicinal application of leeches.

Physics involves the study of the natural laws of the universe, movement and energy, celestial mechanics, astronomy and meterology. Its practioners usually make a clear deliniation between the study of physics and the study of the wyrd, unworldly and unnatural laws (possibly to protect themselves from pogroms and witch hunts).

This ability represents the study of the machinations that occur in the upper ranks of power in society, its application, its history and its heraldry. This includes political theory: Real Politics and Machiavellian dealings and important historical treaties and maneveurings.

At first rank the character has knowledge of the history and current affairs of some local regions nobility and royalty. They know the heraldic insignias of these nobles and important state organizations. They understand the laws of succession in that region. They know most of the commonly known court intrigue and have a decent understanding of the machinations and manoevering of the ruling classes.
At each rank above the first the character gains this understanding for a new Society.
The character knows how to make magical potions given a lab, time and the right ingredients.

The study of religions, their belief systems, rituals and history. At rank 1 the character has some knowledge of religious philosophies, legends and lore. At higher ranks the they can identify most religious symbols and quote from their texts. In order to cast clerical spells the character also needs Theurgic Lore which deals which deals with the mechanics of theological spell casting.

At rank 4 the character has a deep knowledge of numerous religions both living and dead. The characters depth of knowledge is deep enough that they may pass as a follower of many faiths when questioned.
At fifth rank the character can enter a trance that releases stress, appears as if the character is dead, can reduce the characters oxygen consumption, and reduce the effect of poisonous miasmas.
